item.title: Picoroco add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "He who receives an idea from me, receives instruction himself without lessening mine; as he who lights his taper at mine, receives light without darkening me." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Picoroco add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "...nothing in them but tittering jeering emptiness." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: Picoroco add a quote by Flann O'Brien
item.description: "In Boston he met a pretty lady, fat and forty, but beautiful with the bloom of cash and collateral." -- Flann O'Brien

item.title: Picoroco add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Picoroco add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Picoroco add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Picoroco add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Picoroco add a quote by Howard Zinn
item.description: "There is no flag large enough to cover the shame of killing innocent people." -- Howard Zinn

item.title: Picoroco add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Picoroco add a quote by Gore Vidal
item.description: "[Professor] Frank recalled my idle remark some years ago: 'Never pass up the opportunity to have sex or appear on television.' Advice I would never give today in the age of AIDS and its television equivalent Fox News." -- Gore Vidal

item.title: Picoroco add a quote by Saki
item.description: "I hate posterity - it's so fond of having the last word." -- Saki

item.title: Picoroco add a quote by John Kenneth Galbraith
item.description: "Wisdom... is often an abstraction associated not with fact or reality but with the man who asserts it and the manner of its assertion." -- John Kenneth Galbraith

item.title: Picoroco add a quote by John Kenneth Galbraith
item.description: "It is a far, far better thing to have a firm anchor in nonsense than to put out on the troubled seas of thought." -- John Kenneth Galbraith

item.title: Picoroco add a quote by W.C. Fields
item.description: "I cook with wine, sometimes I even add it to the food." -- W.C. Fields

item.title: Picoroco add a quote by Gore Vidal
item.description: "You can't really succeed with a novel anyway; they're too big. It's like city planning. You can't plan a perfect city because there's too much going on that you can't take into account. You can, however, write a perfect sentence now and then. I have." -- Gore Vidal

item.title: Picoroco add a quote by Patrick O'Brian
item.description: "Jack, you've debauched my sloth." -- Patrick O'Brian

item.title: Picoroco add a quote by Patrick O'Brian
item.description: "That would be locking the horse after the stable door is gone, a very foolish thing to do." -- Patrick O'Brian

item.title: Picoroco add a quote by Cicero
item.description: "If you have a garden and a library, you have everything you need." -- Cicero

item.title: Picoroco add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald
